value.title: Jeff Stein: Trump's last-minute push for larger stimulus checks example of 'long-running tension' with other Republicans
value.excerpt: In an interview on Hill.TV’s “Rising,” Stein said Trump had told allies that he wanted new stimulus checks as large as $2,000 per person, even as congressional leadership is preparing a package that would provide checks of just $600 each.

value.title: Supreme Court rules it's too early to review Trump census plan to exclude undocumented immigrants from House redistricting
value.excerpt: The U.S. has always counted citizens and non-citizens for the purposes of redrawing congressional districts every 10 years.

value.title: Black family in Texas says cars set on fire, house vandalized with 'Trump 20' over BLM sign
value.excerpt: Jayla Gipson and Charles Crawford said the incident was brought on by a Black Lives Matter sign they put in their yard around Thanksgiving.

value.title: Abortion, Guns and Trump: A Church Group Tries to Navigate America’s Divisions
value.excerpt: In suburban Michigan, a group of worshipers from Calvary Christian Reformed Church sought understanding through dialogue. Sometimes it was tough going. ‘My soul is hurting,’ one member lamented.

value.title: Trump appoints 1776 Commission members in last-minute bid to advance 'patriotic education'
value.excerpt: The group will be led by the president of the conservative Hillsdale College, Larry Arnn, a longtime Trump ally, the White House said.

value.title: Trump, ahead of FDA, says Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine has been approved
value.excerpt: U.S. President Donald Trump in a tweet on Friday said Moderna Inc's vaccine had been approved and would ship immediately, although the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has made no public announcement yet regarding its decision.

value.title: Atlantic City auctions off chance to push demolish button on former Trump casino
value.excerpt: The implosion of one of President Donald Trump's former Atlantic City casinos is being delayed by a few weeks.

value.title: Late Night Compares Trump Health Adviser, Paul Alexander, to a Comic Book Villain
value.excerpt: The former Health and Human Services adviser’s leaked emails encouraged herd immunity to deal with the pandemic, writing of Americans, “We want them infected.”

value.title: Seth Meyers: Trump's 'going to be our first nomad ex-president'
value.excerpt: Late-night hosts discuss a request by residents of Palm Beach, Florida, to keep Trump from residing in Mar-a-Lago and belated GOP admissions of Biden’s victory

value.title: What comes next for a Donald Trump impersonator? J-L Cauvin has thoughts
value.excerpt: J-L Cauvin, a full-time lawyer who became a social media sensation as an impersonator, has plans for comedy after the Donald leaves the White House.

value.title: U.N. Security Council to talk Western Sahara after Trump policy switch
value.excerpt: The U.N. Security Council is planning to discuss Western Sahara on Monday, diplomats said, after U.S. President Donald Trump recognized Morocco's sovereignty over the disputed region in return for the kingdom normalizing ties with Israel.

value.title: Cybersecurity Official Fired by Trump Says U.S. Election Was Secure
value.excerpt: Christopher Krebs told a Senate panel that allegations that voting equipment was manipulated during the election are baseless, and that spreading them undermines confidence in democracy and the election outcome.

value.title: Report: Trump Contemplating Not Leaving White House on January 20
value.excerpt: One of the very few remaining mysteries surrounding Donald Trump — a very simple man prone to blurting out his feelings around the clock in whatever medium he has available — is whether or to what degree he is conscious of his lies.

value.title: Cardinal Pell on Trump, Benedict XVI and a plot against him
value.excerpt: Pope Francis’ former treasurer, Cardinal George Pell, has praised President Donald Trump’s “splendid” Supreme Court appointments and defense of Christian values

value.title: North Carolina GOP lawmaker urges Trump to suspend civil liberties to keep power: ‘Invoke the Insurrection Act’
value.excerpt: Republican North Carolina state Sen. Bob Steinburg said President Trump should declare a national emergency, suspend civil rights, and remain in power over his baseless claims of electoral fraud.

value.title: Analysis-Federal Reserve 'boneheads' emerge from Trump era unscathed
value.excerpt: "Boneheads." "Pathetic." An "enemy" of the United States. President Donald Trump was often vicious in his critique of the U.S. Federal Reserve, bashing the central bank governors' monetary policy decisions with tweets and verbal barbs,

value.title: Trump lashes out at McConnell for recognizing Biden’s victory: ‘People are angry!’
value.excerpt: President Trump pleaded with Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to continue supporting his efforts to undermine the election after McConnell acknowledged President-elect Joe Biden's win in the electoral college.

value.title: Iran's Rouhani says he is happy that 'lawless' Trump is leaving office
value.excerpt: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said on Wednesday he was happy that Donald Trump was leaving office, calling him "the most lawless U.S. president" and a "terrorist".

value.title: Coronavirus live news: London enters tier 3 restrictions; Trump will 'absolutely' encourage vaccine use
value.excerpt: One in four people globally may not get vaccines until 2022; EU likely to approve vaccine within days; Canada signs deal to accelerate Moderna vaccine deliveries

value.title: Trump antagonizes Republicans with Georgia fundraising ploy
value.excerpt: Emails and texts raising cash for Trump's PAC have rankled Republicans, who want cash to flow directly to Georgia's endangered GOP senators.

value.title: Trudeau's digital tax flexes Canada's muscles with Trump on the way out
value.excerpt: "The idea that Canada would go ahead with an early tax probably would have invited a tariff by Trump," says one observer.

value.title: The Note: Electoral College voting brings crossroads for Trump and his GOP
value.excerpt: Trump looms large over the future of the Republican Party. But his interests and those of his party are already diverging.

value.title: How the ‘deep state’ scientists vilified by Trump helped him deliver an unprecedented achievement
value.excerpt: A $14-billion partnership between government and industry is spurring the quickest vaccine development in U.S. history.

value.title: Trump's conspiracies pose 'existential' threat to electronic voting industry -Smartmatic
value.excerpt: Conspiracy theories about how voting machines were used to stop the re-election of Donald Trump have not just sapped Americans' faith in the democratic process - they also pose an existential threat to the market for electronic voting systems worldwide,

value.title: CNN's Jake Tapper thanks Trump for 'exposing' Republicans who supported Texas' 'un-democratic, un-American, mendacious joke of a lawsuit'
value.excerpt: Tapper closed his show with a blistering attack on Trump and Republicans for their "desperate desire to subvert the will of the American people."

value.title: Saturday Night Live Mocks Trump's New Favorite Network Newsmax
value.excerpt: Trump network Newsmax's coverage with a sketch introducing its latest television offering—a sports network that refuses to acknowledge the New York Jets ever lose. The sketch opens with a voiceover that claims "millions of real Americans are switching from Fox News to Newsmax because Newsmax tells them the

value.title: Pro-Trump protests decry president's election loss, opposing groups clash in Washington
value.excerpt: Conservative groups claiming without evidence that the Nov. 3 election was stolen from President Donald Trump staged protests across the country on Saturday, with one in Washington turning violent at times as police broke up sporadic clashes after dark.

value.title: Twitter says it 'inadvertently' limited engagements on Trump's flagged tweets
value.excerpt: Twitter Inc said on Saturday it had "inadvertently" limited engagements for a brief period on U.S. President Donald Trump's tweets with "disputed" labels but later reversed its action.

value.title: Federal court judge dismisses 'extraordinary' Trump lawsuit seeking to overturn Wisconsin election
value.excerpt: U.S. District Judge Brett Ludwig — a Trump nominee — concluded Wisconsin officials had followed state laws when they conducted the Nov. 3 election.

value.title: Fox News Conspired to Overthrow Trump, MyPillow CEO Tells 'Stop the Steal' March
value.excerpt: "I'm serious, they had to be on it!" Mike Lindell said of Fox News. "They should all go to prison when they are found out."
